author: NORBAITI PHAHARORADZI
title: Satay on wheels
text:
by norbaiti phaharoradzi Muhammad Nazim uses a secret recipe to make his satay. 
GELANG PATAH: A former welder has come up with a unique way to sell satay by going door to door on his motorcycle. 
Mobile satay seller Muhammad Nazim Mohd Yusoff, 37, had to quit his job as an odd job worker because of health problems. 
“I had been unemployed for two years and my wife had to get a job as a cleaner to make ends meet,” said the father of three children between the ages of two and eight years. 
The Kelantan-born said he was glad that his experience as a part-time worker in a satay stall helped him get back on his feet and put food on the table. 
“I thought this was a good idea as my customers can see the sticks of satay being grilled in front of them. 
“It also tastes better eaten hot,” he said in an interview at his house at Jalan Mohd Said, Kampung Ulu Pulai. Muhammad Nazim decided to sell satay to support his family. 
Muhammad Nazim said to attract customers, he tweaked the dish by comparing several varieties in town before coming up with his own using a secret recipe. 
“Due to my health condition, I only sell satay within Taman Nusa Bayu between 8pm and 11.30pm daily. 
“I can only carry 350 sticks of chicken and beef satay,” he said, adding that each stick of chicken and beef satay costs RM0.70 and RM0.80 respectively, with free ketupat. 
He started his business with a capital of only RM500 and uses a normal satay grill. 
Muhammad Nazim is happy his hard work is paying off as satisfied customers help to promote his satay through Facebook. 
He also takes catering orders. 
“My wife has been a pillar of strength as most of the work is done by her, from buying and preparing the ingredients to packing them,” he said.
